contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} [[File:Map.Eigenji-Town.Shiga.PNG|thumb|Location of Eigenji]] [[File:Eigen-ji (Rinzai temple).jpg|thumb|Eigen-ji temple]] {{Nihongo|'''Eigenji'''|永源寺町|Eigenji-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] in [[Kanzaki District, Shiga|Kanzaki District]], [[Shiga Prefecture]], [[Japan]], at the western foot of [[Suzuka Mountains]]. On February 11, 2005 Eigenji was merged with the town of [[Gokashō, Shiga|Gokashō]], also from [[Kanzaki District, Shiga|Kanzaki District]], the towns of [[Aitō, Shiga|Aitō]] and [[Kotō, Shiga|Kotō]], both from [[Echi District, Shiga|Echi District]], and the old city of [[Yōkaichi, Shiga|Yōkaichi]], to form the new city of [[Higashiōmi, Shiga|Higashiōmi]]. In 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 6,194 and a [[population density|density]] of 34.17 persons per km². The total area was 181.27 km². The town was named after a famous temple [[Eigen-ji]] and it is a key spot for viewing the [[Acer palmatum|momiji]] leaves turn red in the autumn. Mountain villages in east of the town is famous for rare [[green tea]] and had been a base of traditional woodworkers since 9th century. == External links == *[http://www.higashiomi.net/eigenji/ Eigenji Tourist Information Guide] {{ja}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Shiga Prefecture]] {{Shiga-geo-stub}}
